tweets.text:
Our team are on their way to #Bewdley to provide hot food and refreshments to the local public and emergency services affected by the #floods and #snow 

@RaviSinghKA @Khalsa_Aid @EnvAgencyMids @ITVWales @nspauk @SikhPA @live_coventry @MarcusRashford @covobservernews https://t.co/H2t8xtk2GM

Brilliant example by @EnvAgencyYNE of using a tidal defence asset to exclude the tide to make room for incoming fluvial water reducing upstream river flooding.

This clever thinking shows how to make the most out of existing FCRM assets & perhaps better justify new ones. üìèüìêüåä https://t.co/cAbA0wufEc

Our teams have been working 24/7 to help communities affected by #StormChristoph. Thanks to all our tireless colleagues on the ground for all their hard work, we‚Äôve protected thousands of homes from flooding. #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/YXQaxoevsW

@wiltscouncil Think your images of the road routes for the Chippenham extensions really underestimate the River Avon flood area on fields. Pretty much the whole fields flood, not just a few meters either side of river. @EnvAgencySW

tweets.text: Our @EnvAgencyMids teams are still out monitoring and checking assets all along the #Severn Andy from the #Worcestershire field team has shared these pictures of #Bewdley Severnside barriers now covered in snow. #StayAtHome #covidsafe https://t.co/V1QBA8EUUC

tweets.text: @metoffice @EnvAgencyMids @DaveThroupEA @TelfordWrekin üé• "If you don't have to be out, then why not stay indoors or enjoy the snow in your garden?" Jon Fraser from @WorcsTravel has been updating us on the situation in Worcestershire #HeartNews https://t.co/rYskXlwyYr
Sadly nothing will change while they @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency continue to call Combined Sewage Overflowsüí©Storm Overflows üí©https://t.co/v8CaD1OWFa

@EnvAgency Thank you for supporting residents and communities during and after the event (much appreciated)... how about spending some money, implementing policy and RMAs work together BEFORE the next event?
Communities are suffering repeatedly and the Gov seems to have abandoned us üò°

We have closed the Hull Tidal Surge Barrier tonight at low tide to help reduce water levels in the #RiverHull. The 212 tonne steel gate will prevent tidal water entering the River Hull, creating additional space to drain river water. https://t.co/sPqrXyqZ6r

Good morning to a snowy Shropshire. Today, we'll be in #Bridgnorth with our colleagues from @EnvAgencyMids supporting residents and businesses. Our Highways team will also be on the ground commencing clean-up and repairs providing water levels allow. Stay safe. https://t.co/EPfqHv9sQE
@ConnorPR @BorisJohnson @ShropCouncil @EnvAgency @DKShrewsbury Nice touch with the diffuser, you‚Äôd be better off throwing that horseshoe at someone

tweets.text:
While #StormOverflows play a role in preventing sewage from entering our streets and homes during storms or heavy rain, we want to prevent the damage they cause to rivers and bathing waters.

We‚Äôre doing this through the Storm Overflows Taskforce. Read ‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/lUoIewlbzi https://t.co/dNbzHWrWuE

urls.title: Taskforce sets goal to end pollution from storm overflows
urls.description: New commitments from the water industry aim to increase transparency around storm overflows.

tweets.text:
Massive WELL DONE & THANK YOU to @EnvAgency @NorthYorksFire @RyedaleDC @scarrescue @NortonSalvos @keanedunk and volunteers who helped save #Norton and #Malton from serious flooding  #Ryedale #RiverDerwent 

Pictures from Kirkham Abbey https://t.co/h5zzqPzvH7

This is not right @EnvAgency @thameswater @SE_Rivers_Trust the next round of outfall aims and plans surely can't be based on these kind of calculations @LDNWaterkeeper? As the predictive models will just keep allowing things to get worse. https://t.co/87pjoYBKTH

We have deployed a number of pumps in and around Malton and Norton to protect the community from flooding, working with @RyedaleDC @northyorkscc & @YorkshireWater to mange and alleviate flooding. Stay #floodaware https://t.co/4duBrDlDPe

tweets.text:
üîä #Incident #Update üîä

@EnvAgencyYNE #FieldTeam have installed 3 Ultra High Volume Pumps at #Wistow near #Selby. (Started last night and finished up this morning).

These pumps shift over 1 tonne of water a second!

These pumps are reducing the #flood levels in the village. https://t.co/zAc6fvYp0h

Still some flooded roads in #Dallam but water levels receding today allowing homeowners back to start the clear up.  Speaking to @EnvAgencyNW  and @pow_rebecca to ensure the scenes we‚Äôve witnessed over last 72 hours don‚Äôt return. #Warrington #StormChristoph https://t.co/0A0HlMYuPL

@wheat_daddy @DaveThroupEA Years ago the NRA did a bloody good job of looking after our rivers. Since they fired all the actual workers and became the EA they still collect all the money but do bugger all for it. Just a load of overpaid office jockeys!

tweets.text: Busy few days for us attending #flooding in #York and #Malton. Providing support with our #Swiftwater rescue and #HighVolumePump. It‚Äôs a big multiagency response protecting the people of North Yorkshire. @NorthYorksFire @HVPCapability @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/2xKbtD32IB
@DarrylSussex @Greengrumbler @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgencyAnglia I think so ü§î

Meanwhile 20mm of rain over south #herefordshire has caused this.

#soilpatrol has been out today and this farmer will be receiving a visit. https://t.co/abaUme57we
@RussellB1ggs @Greengrumbler @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgencyAnglia Have the farmer & landowned been reported before?

@DarrylSussex @Greengrumbler @Feargal_Sharkey Darryl  reported to the EA at 11am yesterday incident no 1882911 & EA officer arrived at 4.30pm üëçhis car got stuck in the mud/üêñüí©& with the help of the local residents we pushed his car through the mud ü•µhe took samples by torchlight & didn‚Äôt leave till 7pm @EnvAgencyAnglia üëè

@PJennings88 The Sewage Overflow Assessment Framework is just another failed attempt by the @EnvAgency to exonerate themselves for any responsibility for the appalling state of our rivers. 

It's a shameful document.

@metoffice @EnvAgencyMids @DaveThroupEA There are problems on the #M5 and the #M42 because of snow. Thee M5 is partly blocked in both directions near the M50, while the M5 is slow around Redditch #HeartNews https://t.co/ahkNIPi7a7
@RussellB1ggs @Greengrumbler @Feargal_Sharkey have you seen this horror? Farm effluent making rivers septic. Who‚Äôs the Water Authority for this area?

tweets.text: @EnvAgency  @CanalRiverTrust @stwater . There's been serious erosion to the weir opposite Trent Side (upstream on the two major weirs on Attenborough NR). Water over path was max 80cm deep. A hole 3m diameter and ca 1 m deep is undermining the weir structure. Access Long Eaton

With all Flood Risk Management agencies stretched at this time, we are assisting @EnvAgencyYNE with the operation of the Market Weighton Canal ship lock, to reduce water levels across the catchment. https://t.co/ov4xOj0qVL
@loosecollie @herefordtimes @bbchw @EnvAgency @DailyMailUK @HfdsCouncil And dredge.....
@LyndonGore2 @herefordtimes @bbchw @EnvAgency @DailyMailUK @HfdsCouncil It would be a shame to lose it. Maintain the river,put a weir in by hunderton rail bridge and the job is done!

@loosecollie @herefordtimes @bbchw @EnvAgency @DailyMailUK @HfdsCouncil That's another option for sure but we heard this after last years flood and got nowhere.
Residents would prefer no old bridge.

tweets.text:
@loosecollie @herefordtimes @bbchw @EnvAgency @DailyMailUK Hi martin, just read your comments re kingsland river bank.
I live in greyfriars in hereford, we have been asking for years to get these rivers dredged. 2 metres if silt at the old bridge, remove that much we can all live in peace.
